snippet: On a huge stretch of scrubland in central Wyoming, a two-year federal crime-fighting initiative has made little difference.
abstract: Obama administration's two-year federal crime-fighting initiative makes little difference on the Wind River Indian Reservation in Wyoming, where violent crime increased by 7 percent during the effort; despite its bucolic name, the reservation is a place where brutal acts have become banal; a rambling stretch of scrub in central Wyoming the size of Rhode Island and Delaware combined, Wind River has a crime rate five to seven times the national average and a long history of ghastly homicides.
lead_paragraph: On a huge stretch of scrubland in central Wyoming, a two-year federal crime-fighting initiative has made little difference.

headline.seo: Brutal Crimes Grip Wind River Indian Reservation
headline.main: Brutal Crimes Grip an Indian Reservation
headline.print_headline: An Indian Reservation in Crime’s Deadly Grip
